Article.html:
In several Redash visualizations you can control how the numbers are formatted. You control the format by suppplying a format string. Below you can find examples for the various format options.

Numbers

Number Format Output
10000 '0,0.0000' 10,000.0000
10000.23 '0,0' 10,000
10000.23 '+0,0' +10,000
-10000 '0,0.0' -10,000.0
10000.1234 '0.000' 10000.123
100.1234 '00000' 00100
1000.1234 '000000,0' 001,000
10 '000.00' 010.00
10000.1234 '0[.]00000' 10000.12340
-10000 '(0,0.0000)' (10,000.0000)
-0.23 '.00' -.23
-0.23 '(.00)' (.23)
0.23 '0.00000' 0.23000
0.23 '0.0[0000]' 0.23
1230974 '0.0a' 1.2m
1460 '0 a' 1 k
-104000 '0a' -104k
1 '0o' 1st
100 '0o' 100th

Currency

Number Format Output
1000.234 '$0,0.00' $1,000.23
1000.2 '0,0[.]00 $' 1,000.20 $
1001 '$ 0,0[.]00' $ 1,001
-1000.234 '($0,0)' ($1,000)
-1000.234 '$0.00' -$1000.23
1230974 '($ 0.00 a)' $ 1.23 m

Bytes

Number Format Output
100 '0b' 100B
1024 '0b' 1KB
2048 '0 ib' 2 KiB
3072 '0.0 b' 3.1 KB
7884486213 '0.00b' 7.88GB
3467479682787 '0.000 ib' 3.154 TiB

Percentages

Number Format Output
100 '0%' 100%
97.4878234 '0.000%' 97.488%
-4.3 '0 %' -4 %
65.43 '(0.000 %)' 65.430 %

Exponential

Number Format Output
1123456789 '0,0e+0' 1e+9
12398734.202 '0.00e+0' 1.24e+7
0.000123987 '0.000e+0' 1.240e-4
